explanation: The report is correct. In a translation unit compiled with HAVE_GETHRTIME defined, the code in that block is compiled as an unconditional return (if (1) return ...;). Because the blocks are sequential, once execution reaches that compiled-in block it will always return, so the final statement return time(NULL) - sys_clock_start; can never be reached in that build configuration. That is unreachable code in the compiled project, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1. (Note: the same issue also appears for other platform cases that use if (1) return ...;.)
